intro: Vincetoxicum mugodsharicum, commonly known as the Kyzylkum devil's fig, is a species of flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers followed by distinctive, fleshy, orange-red fruits. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
